xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class DifferenceKernelEstimator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
          xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.DifferenceKernelEstimator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double>, Differentiable, RealFunction
public class DifferenceKernelEstimator
extends AbstractRealFunctionFunction
implements Differentiable

This class provides a difference kernel estimator (dke). A dke is an estimator for the local differences of a continuous probability density function. As proposed in
[Qui94]: P. Qiu. Estimation of the number of jumps of the jump regression functions. Communications in Statistics-Theory and Methods 23. 2141-2155. 1994,
a dke could be used as an estimator for change points based upon a sample drawn from a continuous entirety.

See Also:
AbstractRealFunctionFunction, KernelFunction, KernelBandwidths, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DifferenceKernelEstimator

public DifferenceKernelEstimator(KernelFunction kf1,
                                 double l1,
                                 double c1,
                                 KernelFunction kf2,
                                 double l2,
                                 double c2,
                                 java.lang.Object[] sample,
                                 double h)
Constructs a new difference kernel estimator, which could be used for change-point-detection.

Parameters:
kf1 - used Kernel function for the left transformation
l1 - left interval border of the used interval for the left transformation.
c1 - transformed interval width of the left interval
kf2 - used Kernel function for the right transformation
l2 - right interval border of the used interval for the right transformation.
c2 - transformed interval width of the right interval
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
h - used bandwidth the compute the difference kernel estimator
See Also:
KernelFunction, TransformedKernelFunction

DifferenceKernelEstimator

public DifferenceKernelEstimator(KernelFunction kf,
                                 double l,
                                 double c,
                                 java.lang.Object[] sample,
                                 double h)
Constructs a new difference kernel estimator, which could be used for change-point-detection.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function for the transformation
l - left interval border of the used interval for transformation. The left border will be given as (-1.0) * l - c.
c - transformed interval width
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
h - used bandwidth the compute the difference kernel estimator
See Also:
KernelFunction, TransformedKernelFunction

DifferenceKernelEstimator

public DifferenceKernelEstimator(KernelFunction kf,
                                 java.lang.Object[] sample,
                                 double h)
Constructs a new difference kernel estimator, which could be used for change-point-detection.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function for the transformation to [-2.0, -1.0] and [1.0, 2.0]. This complies to calling the constructor with DifferenceKernelEstimator ( kf, -2.0, 1.0, kf, 1.0, 1.0, sample, h).
sample - sample of a data set given as Object [] containing objects of type Number
h - used bandwidth the compute the difference kernel estimator
See Also:
KernelFunction, TransformedKernelFunction

derivative

public RealFunction derivative()
                        throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the derivatives of the dke as {RealFunction.

Specified by:
derivative in interface Differentiable
Returns:
derivative of the dke based upon the derivatives of the used transformed kernel functions
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformed kernel functions and so the underlying kernel functions are not differentiable.
